CEB7E063B7204A8B90831441D6ECE1BF.description: The student will demonstrate appropriate customs in various liturgical situations.

73465F3089DD40BFB64F40DD427EC1FB.description: The student will demonstrate appropriate reverence during prayer.

2D68F5D5AECD4988BA547FAF3C62F798.description: The student will demonstrate the use of different types of prayer .

D754C2867E8A47BCBD3C89E64F0F2B99.description: The student will participate in meditative prayer.

49F0D7F04210485D9FA2A5F429A57B19.description: The student will participate in traditional Marian devotions .

622ECEED844D4A09A80502F9F790F53F.description: The student will discuss and/or participate in Eucharistic devotions such as Adoration, Forty Hours, and Benediction .

B6CC88AACEBC4840BF5B4CCFDEA5B7A5.description: The student will pray for openness and generous response to God's call in their lives.

D0B19C19D35E4362A747F34FEF7FDF9D.description: The student will discuss the effectiveness of prayer in working toward peace and justice .

65C81026CA3D46A3AE13DFA1432229B6.description: The student will analyze the seven petitions of the Our Father .

5109C3D68EBD40358AD923A256928065.description: The student will identify gospel passages that demonstrate the importance of prayer in Jesus' life .

33EEDEB6EF05416A826CC780E5ED8AD6.description: The student will identify some familiar prayers of New Testament figures (Magnifcat of Mary, canticles of Zechariah, Simeon, and Anna in Luke, etc.))

056C1E30337A4F76AD1C9EB3D9380073.description: The student will recite common prayers of the Catholic Church .

C80FC3120BBF480FBD72130C58325738.description: The student will identify some saints who modeled social justice principles .

126F71520C1647C99193EF35ECA14CDA.description: The student will help design, organize, and/or participate in a student-directed service project.

EC88F71738004C138757AF08B9816BB9.description: The student will take age-appropriate action to make their voices heard on social justice issues (i.e., write letters to congressmen, respect life essays, cleaning up trash, recycling, etc.)

2F413C2E4DB74496B747186B56F758E0.description: The student will identify the principles of social justice (see Appendix for resources)

522F3055199C46C4A4919B2B783AC3A3.description: The student will discuss that every right has a corresponding responsibility. Identify some responsibilities related to the rights of human persons.

CAA505B0C6E849B2BB38978435590222.description: The student will create suggestions for peaceful alternatives and solutions for poverty, violence, oppression, etc. which rob persons of their human dignity.

894B0BF9B4A2469486BCCC3A71C26062.description: The student will discuss how gospel values are the foundation of social, economic, and political choices.

3DF13EAB637947888312DC8EDE6A7087.description: The student will select some Gospel passages in which Jesus demonstrated a life of service to others.

E220563EBDDB420BA9A049E88016DBA8.description: The student will list and explain the cardinal or moral virtues, the theological virtues, and the seven capital sins.

8320AE305C704BD1AE90E02CABA346EE.description: The student will compose a personal examination of conscience based on the Ten Commandments and the Beatitudes.

1366FDE73D834F92BA67D48754A9D767.description: The student will discuss the consequences of sin to individuals and to the whole body of Christ.

4195019908774A3CB6C19F000B5C3DF3.description: The student will discuss the sacrament of Reconciliation as a way to restore the relationship with God and the community.

08F1D098C98A4444B5FE25859AF5B3F1.description: The student will compare and contrast sins of omission and sins of commission.

0FB74DFF30BA437B9C972546E7324971.description: The student will define the types of sin (mortal, venial).

137826C08D1B41D8B84D4284C76E727E.description: The student will discuss ways that the Gospel events and the parables of Jesus show us how to live a moral life.

A7BC75C2DB41461A84352237C3CF7850.description: The student will describe how each vocation builds up the body of Christ.

A50EC56C40764EADB1D6E24126061D11.description: The student will describe the benefits  and challenges of vocations to the single, married, religious, or ordained life.

6027F504997245DC99BFB05235270E37.description: The student will identify their talents and gifts and describe ways to share these with the community.

51DC8EE977DA4D11BAF24A354CE016CA.description: The student will identify ways that God calls individuals in the New Testament to serve in community and formulate examples of ways that God continues to call us to serve in the community today.

12AADEE9186D40429A32D6829EE32505.description: The student will describe the family as a source of the spiritual values, religious practices, customs and traditions that help shape one physically, psychologically, and socially.

6CF91F9CF4874338A7688032EBFE7DDB.description: The student will define modesty in relation to dress and behavior.

C52AF4B0AFA54CB890A69F3CA3B4354B.description: The student will evaluate contemporary lifestyles and identify those that undermine the value of life.

F5995A884D624500BF7F474686BED602.description: The student will define pornography and discuss appropriate responses (CCC 2523).

F991C4012F6E4377843EB6E113821516.description: The student will discuss the changes in relationships with persons of the other gender.

65F1FD8BFA96418D8D71D4E00ECCDCA2.description: The student will discuss touching safety.

F3179B8DAB994F70B1B48E038E96D7C6.description: The student will explore situations where peer pressure impacts the decisions one makes both positively and negatively.

D78B10CD9143484FB1CB0697D5FE2BE1.description: The student will define marriage as the one flesh union between husband and wife modeled after Christ's union with the Church.

2CD8A3F5E2F04F0DA6208451B6EFC117.description: The student will compare and contrast the true image of marital love as God intended versus contemporary media portrayals of love.

0A2D9987AAA74E9A937F58B9A35BF5E6.description: The student will discuss the deeper meaning of Christ's commandment "to love one another as I have loved you" as it applies to spousal love.

1F3A0D3F0871491387D961953CC172E3.description: The student will identify true love as free, total, faithful, and fruitful.

CF083538FA6B4BA59AA99BA16714922C.description: The student will identify the marital act as unitive and procreative.

BEDF487327FD4CCABC69DAF34EF18565.description: The student will discuss practices that protect this beatiful gift including; appropriate modest dress, language, prayer, sacraments and devotion to Mary.

9887B696928B4297B4485A20BC7005A0.description: The student will discuss chastity as a gift from God that is protected by his grace.

3053B2AB9F754E04B1BA46300475A615.description: The student will identify and define offenses against chastity (CCC 2351-2356).

80CA925B9F924E25B6ED87FAA1CD0320.description: The student will describe the value of the virtue of chastity and ways to live a chaste life. (See the definition of chastity in the glossary of CCC, p. 870.)

6823F77BF7B64C9984E0C2EBCB1368C7.description: The student will define and discuss Catholic virtues and their application (i.e. love, respect, honesty, etc.) to build mature relationships with the opposite sex and all members of society.

C3D29ED49DEB4532B78DCDF7D5491E32.description: The student will evaluate the effects of ones growth and maturation on relationships.

5A404700CD5A4EFF80A1BDB7D301C666.description: The student will identify the human life-cycle and the different ages and stages present in a family unit.

1B2C99AF42324DF5ABC6D1837DD85AFD.description: The student will discuss and apply guidelines for choosing movies, TV programs, music, books, magazines, video games, etc. that are supportive of human dignity.

C4D197A0C03944379C73CBCB87423EC2.description: The student will compare and contrast Christian and secular norms for "success."

596071331EA743D7A6A95BF5A662A3E0.description: The student will give examples of ways to apply the model of Jesus to their daily lives.

1C094F92F18D4261850CE18A6AFAF756.description: The student will use the Beatitudes and the Sermon on the Mount (Matt 5 - 7) as guidelines for living a Christian life.

11CE2845CA2142DF9922485F93882991.description: The student will describe and give examples from Scripture about how Jesus treated people.

C0C876CE80914E39AA13C09D47B3B26C.description: The student will identify some basic rights of all human persons.

7053B0FB02024F29B5C9CEAFB79421E1.description: The student will describe all human life as sacred from conception to natural death.

D8EAECCB9BF24FA79EEC4891F7E9F38B.description: The student will defend the idea of human dignity based on the life and teachings of Jesus.

3BC0F2D6574544FCBADAAF159E81E2B7.description: The student will discuss the source of human dignity as our being created in the image and likeness of God.

744CABFF975940EB8122A12951C21569.description: The student will describe real-lief situations in which they have need of the fruits and gifts of the Holy Spirit.

227F3A36E4404C8FAB47652595DF558A.description: The student will from memory and discuss the gifts and fruits of the Holy Spirit.

71C32F54F6CE4494A60A76C3E9BCB790.description: The student will examine Confirmation as list one of the sacraments of initiation.

E68B1063E1394BFFBBC4AA55532DC2CC.description: The student will define and explain Confirmation as the "sacrament that completes the grace of Baptism by a special outpouring of the gifts of the Holy Spirit which seal or confirm the baptized in union with Christ and equip them for active participation in the worship and apostolic life of the church" (CCC 1285). (See Glossary of the CCC p. 872).

02FC7F8ED0A241D48D178DA8DC3EB7C1.description: The student will consider the Sacrament of Confirmation in detail in the year in which they are Confirmed.

65F8C83CA45640E590318497EA370EAF.description: The student will identify Gospel and other New Testament passages that reflect the institution of the sacraments (see Appendix.)

233BA6E4C3B24AF68F5683C12912A9C2.description: The student will explain how Jesus instituted the sacraments to give grace.

CF7DBA06AD8F4FDFB76653769C3578CC.description: The student will participate regularly in the Sacrament of Reconciliation.

E4D337979229406D95E5084869EDA156.description: The student will read, discuss, and reflect on the readings from the upcoming Sunday.

2658E1444F654EF18E17451F738B9798.description: The student will explain the parts of the Mass and how they fit into the order of the Liturgy.

FEBD67513A4E45DB9D9E9C15FE167B4B.description: The student will define the Sacramentary and describe its purpose.

890963CEE02246E2B256C6FA15C3A2B2.description: The student will examine the parts of the Mass.

2974D19DBB004E4ABC37DF7D347C8631.description: The student will participate regularly in the planning and celebration of the Eucharist (i.e. writing the intercessory prayers, acting as lector, cantor, acolyte, gift bearers, ushers, etc.)

D0028662EB8F4717B402272AEA2E7741.description: Strand II: Celebration of the Christian Mystery

FBD08C0CB58147DDB4E8D45D8EAD8689.description: The student will explain particular judgment and general judgment.

0FEC1295B05044E295E447A5E6958250.description: The student will relate the second coming of Christ as found in passages from the Gospels, Epistles, and Revelation 22:17.

6C953EAF63114049A0366509D1F155E2.description: The student will explain the concept of Purgatory, as identified in 2 Maccabees 12:38-46 and Church tradition.

C6CCFE534249431BAC47E2FA88288736.description: The student will explain the Communion of Saints as the pilgrims on earth, the dead whom are being purified, and the blessed in Heaven (CCC 962).

2C6B5D641A56497E9B04E716BAE97956.description: The student will list the names of the archangels (Michael, Gabriel, and Raphael) and describe the tasks associated with them.

CDEC4F545384472582FC74615E3BFB56.description: The student will recall that an angel is "a spiritual, personal, and immortal creature, with intelligence and free will, who glorifies God without ceasing and who serves God as a messenger of his saving plan."

D3B3B6C64C4144E4B6E3D2EBB3F1DE35.description: The student will explain the titles of Mary given to her from tradition and proclamation.

BFA2EA46133B43D6AE80D202D82A87B4.description: The student will discuss the apparitions of Mary approved by the Church: Our Lady of Lourdes, Our Lady of Fatima, Our Lady of Guadalupe, etc.

AD627AE5B1B64A6780549BB780DC69A4.description: The student will identify and explain the dogmas of  the Immaculate Conception and the Assumption.

9ED76E2D34544E68B2E545EDA03CBC03.description: The student will describe events in the life of Mary found in the Gospel and tradition.

4D2F1376025F4ECFB1FB1DF1EA03C4C5.description: The student will define Transubstantiation as the unique change of the Eucharistic bread and wine into the Body and Blood of Jesus at the consecration of the Mass.

DF8937B9655D43B7898E62AD9D23C7AC.description: The student will define hypostatic union as Jesus Christ being true GOd and true Man in one Person.

51169CBFF50E46708005C69D0F55E4C7.description: The student will define the Incarnation as the Son of God assumed a human nature in order to accomplish our salvation in it.

4D8D808752B443CA9B6A9D822EBE3D04.description: The student will identify the mission of Jesus as Savior of all.

2F0C86773D3D4CBB92ADE3DA63E46C8A.description: The student will list and explain the titles of Jesus.

BC560BCB5FEA4E9C99F2D248571F7C1C.description: The student will explore the development of various Catholic feast days based on cultural traditions (St. Nicholas, Christmas, St. Patrick, etc.)

922A788CC8834AC6B4B4EB8CFC596AA0.description: The student will discuss Mary's role in the history of the Church.

9944E9D8788D44EFBFBF14B0AB828B85.description: The student will examine the role of the Holy Spirit within the early Church.

FF3FE0E5734144E0AE982587269B605B.description: The student will trace the establishment of the Church from the preaching of Jesus, through the Paschal mystery, Pentecost, and apostolic succession.

1529989548124CB9AA65AD25FB2AEE5E.description: The student will retell how the Apostles were selected and commissioned.

500A24C2E3B74486A3BCECDD20844F05.description: The student will identify how Jesus fulfills the Old Testament prophesy.

7BBD6A8A3EEB48A7AC0B22F6088B3814.description: The student will analyze some themes in the Epistles and compare them to our lives today.

76D08A7D3B4C41C6843A69F7BC4120EB.description: The student will identify themes in the Epistles (community, law, grace, salvation, Body of Christ, love, second coming, etc.)

12729408F9E746BDBB6094FEE5D47D1F.description: The student will define the Epistles as letters written to various early Christian communities to encourage them to follow the teachings of Jesus.

2DD67775C6354A01BB92D366A49A0AAC.description: The student will identify the Beatitudes/Sermon on the Mount as the central message in Jesus' teaching.

D9DBB9DDA5E24C95A444264395F48743.description: The student will retell some parables and explain them in meaningful terms for our lives today.

1C93F9A9C3C14DE2A38FABCCE2780870.description: The student will define parables as stories Jesus told to teach a lesson about the Kingdom of God.

2018AAB8E06F4E0CAE5BD61693991D74.description: The student will retell and explain some of the miracles of Jesus.

7D9FAEE88B93454B902EA789368897CE.description: The student will  analyze passages of the gospel that give evidence of the divine human characteristics of Jesus.

D58F8A9A863D4AFB8FE7F4351AC20CAF.description: The student will identify the symbols of the evangelists.

964F1C409CC24C949789FE5CCAF26DEF.description: The student will compare the style and the audiences of the four Gospels.

C4925B3997FA449090559A8A66FDD4A5.description: The student will examine events in the Gospels from the Annunciation to the Resurrection.

68E6CEEB3ADF49BAB1AAACB35803E9B6.description: The student will explain that the Gospels are the accounts of the life of Jesus.
